title.label: RingCentral Glip - Real-time Team Communication - RingCentral, Inc
Must Have For Design, Development, Marketing Agencies and tons more.

content.label:
We have been using Glip for a long time now, and just like us it keeps getting better with age. You wont find another project tool, design collaboration, task, tacking, communication no matter where you are. Never be out of the loop with your team.

Both team and clients begin using it and they love it and wouldnt think about using anything else today. Thanks for am awesome tool and allowing us to be more focused, less email, organized, and did I mention less email :-). Keep up the great work Glip team!

My team has been on glip for a few months and it's okay has some bugs and performance issues but for what it is it usually works. Best feature is send gif needs to improve search and add a code snip it but other than that is ok. We use to use slack but they are too expensive.
Great job guys. Much better than slack or Microsoft teams and we are an office 365 house. Would be nice to have video calling for everyone in the office even the people with no phone line.
Very useful companion to the desktop but is also good stand alone.

title.label: Takes collaboration to a new level

content.label:
I run a news website with ongoing tasks, schedules, assignments, managing multiple writers, and Glip has become an essential part of our workflow and communication. Keeping tasks organized, using groups for communication on different projects, and the notes function are the most helpful for us.
Definitely recommend this app.
I use this app constantly to maintain communications with colleagues and customers. I can send large documents and files through GLIP and do it all from my iPhone. Love this app.

title.label: Glip is The best collaboration/messaging app

content.label:
It has so many more bells and whistles for true collaboration then slack or hip chat not to mention the 80 other mediocre products. 

You have the ability to share notes, tasks and you can do a video call. it's great for teams as well. It really keeps me on track with what I need to do and the instant messaging is fantastic because you can put in at sign in front of persons name and the message will them that you sent them a message so you don't have to scroll through a long thread to figure out which ones are for you. Love that feature.
Moved to Glip from skype and never looked back.  My Dev team loves Glip for collaboration.
Love it. Especially the Glip application. Great tool for teams with projects for accountability and reliability.

Our team moved to the Glip, and actually we left all the other systems, Skype, Trello and other managment systems, everything is in one place and able to create great team work. If it would have a project managment in addition to the Task tool it will make this amazing. Great Job!
This app just keeps getting better. Fast and responsive. Love Glip!
It's got messaging, task management, Calendar, files â what more could you want?

My notifications don't always work, which is annoying because I never know when my group is messaging me. It is nice though to have us all in the group and people usually are able to get back right away.

I've been testing and started using the app for projects. It's working great. Latest version I'm using as of today doesn't give me technical issue. So the previous review maybe an isolated case. 

One user flow issue I come across is that the built-in apps Links, Notes, and Files seem to be artitarily burried under conversation screen even though the content of these apps can be shared across conversations. I initially couldn't find a way to access these apps and only to find out they are a couple levels down. On the other hand, these built in apps are placed on the same level as the conversations in the desktop version. So things are a bit confusing at first for me.

Best of all, it's all free for basic users. Thank you!!

Updated the app on November 22, 2016. The updated version does not work. I can sign in successfully but after that my messages do not load. I never had a problem opening messages before the update. Apparently there is a flaw in the update. Please fix this immediately!

Overall the app is getting better, it use to be very buggy. So thank you for that. There is definitely room for improvement. The following missing features are critical to the way we use it @trnsfm.

1. No ability to comment on a task. This is a huge one since we utilize tasks as a means of organizing conversations and comments within a team.

2. No ability to edit a comment. We all do it, accidentally and and prematurely submit a comment, which is why the web app ability to delete and edit comments is so critical. Something that is also missing from the iOS app.

3. "My tasks" view should be the default "home" screen on the iOS App with the same ability to reorganize tasks as on the web app. The reorganizing capability is what we use to prioritize our tasks for the day and it's order should be directly synced between the iOS app and the web app.

title.label: Great alternative to some names out there

content.label: My firm moved to this app after using some popular alternatives. The incorporation of tasks and the easy (yes not too simple) interface sealed the deal. The application itself could use some upgrades but the Glip team has been adding to it gradually. Overall recommended over alternatives.
LOVE IT!!!!

Glip used to be a patchy and different way to communicate. It didnt have all the features of Slack and wasnt as massive as Skype. Still my company decided to give it a go and since it has gone far beyond what we expected. Features are added constantly and the glip team is very responsive when something is missing or not welcome. Way to go guys.
Needs some work but they are trying

I absolutely love the Glip app for my desktop, but the iOS go up app is hardly comparable to the desktop app. It was easy to convince my coworkers to all switch to Glip from Slack when I showed them the differences between computer apps, but we are all very disappointed by how weak the Glip app is compared to slack for smart phones. For example, we cannot upload attachments from Google Drive or dropbox or Evernote on the mobile app. We also can't turn messages into tasks like we can with the desktop app. I really hope an improved version comes out very soon.

My company rolled out Glip to everyone over a year ago, which we all use on desktop at the office and on mobile while on the go. This app lets me stay on top of my work while I'm away, or feel connected to the office culture even if I can't be part of it in person. It's an invaluable tool for work and i wouldn't want to be without it!

My group decided to move to Glip. I did not want to because Skype was fine the standard and in the common vernacular so new members would already have and know how to participate once they joined. Ever since Microsoft took over Skype it's become as close to software perfection as you can get. The Glip mobile app is on the other end of this spectrum. Some days I get notifications of new posts the vast majority of the time I do not. The design lacks a great deal of finesse and is not appealing to the eye. Much more like brute force software. So I'm basically back about 5 to 7 years with Glip where Skype used to be. Not fun. 

On the plus side the PC app works and you can search for posts and images etc. But I do wish it could be made to alert with sound even if it currently has focus.

Glip's desktop app has been my favorite productivity tool for quite some time, but the mobile app had always been a lackluster and often frustrating experience.

The new iOS app is definitely an improvement over it's predecessor - much more responsive and an overall better designed UI for mobile. Having said that, this new iteration ended up losing a few functions in the process (e.g. task-specific conversations and notes-editing), but it seems that with every update, the Glip team are adding more and more functionality back into the app.

My biggest gripe with all versions of the app that I have used to date is that it's calendar is totally inadequate - you can only view/scan one week at a time, which is unbearably impractical. Until they make the calendar more like...well, an actual calendar (hint: take notes from Google), it's going to hold the mobile experience back.

Despite it's flaws - if you're already a desktop Glip-user, you'll want to download this app purely to continue your team conversations while on the go. Overall, I think Glip is heading in the right direction.
This new update is what I have been waiting for since the older version was lacking features that the browser version had. Now it's nearly perfect and great to see what I have planned with my team.

title.label: Still no way to attach files other than photos

content.label: Seriously RingCentral? You can now "view" files directly in the app, just not actually attach them? RingCentral meetings let's you do this, so what is the deal with your continuing failure to include this feature in the IOS version of Glip? The "desktop" (web app) version of Glip is excellent, and equal to if not superior to similar products such as Slack, but the lack of this feature in the the ios version ruins the platform by crippling its functionality for mobile device users. Please just add this feature already, which would not only complete this app but would nicely round out the trio of services you provide your customers (RingCentral, RingCentral Meetings, and Glip).
Desktop platform is good. Can't use iOS app to update comments to tasks which cripples collaboration on the go. Please update and will add stars to rating.

title.label: Still not up to the task

content.label: Latest update (8/5/16) still does not allow adding files from the app or through iOS (although puzzlingly both ring central and ring central meetings do allow iOS file share). Desktop is great but without a fully functioning app it cripples the platform. This is basically a glorified chat app that also allows you to post photos (only). We already have apps on our phones/tablets that do this and whichever one you use does it better than glip.

title.label: Great all around app but it won't let me change my notification settings

content.label:
I love this app because it helps me organize my small business instead of calling everyone and emailing them separately but whenever I try to change my notification settings it give me an error message saying "we're having trouble changing your setting. Please check your connection" but my connection is fine. I tried my data and wifi plus I even used another employees account and it shows the same thing. 

Plz fix ASAP for a 5 star rate

I've been using this app thought the transition from a web app to a native iOS app. I am glad they took it native, such a big difference. I am happy with the tool and the feature set it provides. Perfect for our team to collaborate on remote onsite projects to keep HQ up to date on progress and status. I think it takes the Slack Apps of the world to the next level.  It gives everyone the same email folder structure; keeps everyone and everything in sync.
Finally it's native!!
This app is light years better beyond the old app! I love it, can do everything I need now to communicate with my team from the palm of my hand, in the office or on the go. Glip is a great tool!
Fast, easy to use, and powerful. Love the new app, a huge improvement.
Wow! What an update! This version is so much better.
After not being able to update, I decided to reinstall it, but now I can't even do that. It's a great app, and I need it for work, so I hope you fix it soon.

title.label: Glip is a poor slack hack and trello knock off

content.label: RingCentral shelps this garbage since they bought it. It's a poor knock off of slack and trello. It's more bad in iOS then web or desktop. I have to use it for work but would like to go "office space" printer bashing to  it pretty much every day.
App crashes a lot. The desktop works well though.

Glip desktop app has been great for our team but the iOS app is terrible. Almost unusable. Crashes constantly, updates slowly, if your phone goes to sleep everything has to reload again. It's a shame because Glip does so many things right in their desktop app.

This is a great idea for an app, and though it's a great idea, it's better executed by Trello. The only reason I don't use this app anymore is that it does not update properly. I can't communicate effectively through this when the app doesn't reflect the changes to tasks that have been made by my team. If the developers cans fix that, it would be much better.
My only real complaint is that it doesn't allow 3rd party keyboards. Other than that, it's a messenger program. And that's what it does.
I can't figure out how often the app refreshes & I can force a refresh/sync.  Also, problems with managing tasks.
That's aweful that you don't have an application for ipad!!!!

title.label: Notifications are broke, switched to Slack

content.label:
App doesn't notify recipient of messages, making it useless in a business environment. 

Update: was informed today by the support team about their odd notification setup: 

"Let me explain how both email and mobile push notifications work on Glip. When youâre offline (i.e., sign out of Glip or close Glip) or inactive for 15 minutes or more, you will receive a notification at each 60-second break in a conversation. We do this so that we donât flood you with notifications for every single message in an active conversation. So, if youâre trying to test out notifications, make sure youâre signed out of Glip for at least a minute after your colleague sends you a message so that youâll receive a notification."

This basically means we can't use it in a business environment as we need on demand notifications for all 1-1 IM's. To bad.

You can't have a title that says "Real-Time Team Productivity," but not have an iPad optimized version. Super fail. 

Not to rub it in, but Slack has an iOS 9 optimized version. Please update Glip so I can get them off slack. Cheers.

App is incredibly slow to open. Once open, app is incredibly slow to load any new messages. Severe delay in typing. Sometimes double posts messages. Extreme lag in receiving new messages. App is unable to load earlier messages if I need to scroll up and view messages.

This new update is killing me. As an employee for a company that works remotely, a mobile app is highly in need. My only concern before this update was that the app did not allow a mute feature to turn off notifications for only a short period of time and turn back on. Now, this new update has completely turned me off to the mobile app. There is no way to get back to the main menu from a message without quitting the whole app. Select/copy/paste feature is not working. And I am unable to reply to assigned tasks. This isn't great for employees who work on the go and may not have a laptop always in hand. Fix your app! PLEASE!

title.label: Doesn't work! The good one was the older version

content.label: I use this app very often to keep up with real time Q&A and field support. The old app (green)used to work fine but ever since I downloaded the new app (blue) it always crashes and doesn't update communication at all .. I have to uninstall then reinstall just to get last messages. They really need to fix ASAP !!

When I found this app I thought to myself, this is everything I need for my business as it's an all in one app solution! I love the idea but the mobile app is horrible, it has crashed on me numerous times today and I just downloaded this app "today"!

title.label: SOOOO BUGGY!  NOT READY FOR IOS :-(

content.label: Great idea, spend less time integrating with Ring Central and more time on your iOS app!  I can't get it to do ANYTHING without crashing, please update and fix it, then release it to the app store...

First I must say the desktop web version of this project management platform is truly remarkable...however, this is a mobile app that defines the true meaning of "falling short" and it's a complete and utter disaster. What I don't understand is Ring Central bought the company and I am so surprised there has been no overhaul to the mobile app to this point. It's a shame because they must not have gotten the memo that today's work environment is mobile and therefore it's no longer a question of if but rather how fast do you improve your app with updates. I want to use glip but I can't because I need an above average mobile app to compliment my desktop app. 

YOU CANT EVEN UPLOAD FILES ONLY IMAGES...I mean come on people how do you miss this one it's really shocking!
